response.original_title: Surviving One of the Deadliest Routes to Europe: Refugees at Sea
response.overview: "Surviving One of the Deadliest Routes to Europe: Refugees at Sea" is a documentary by The New York Times that follows the dangerous journey of refugees crossing the central Mediterranean Seaâ€”one of the deadliest migration routes to Europe. It highlights the harsh realities faced by migrants, many fleeing violence, poverty, and abuse in countries like Libya, and risking their lives in overcrowded, unsafe boats. The film also shows the rescue efforts of humanitarian organizations and the political and legal challenges they face. It offers a powerful, human-centered perspective on the ongoing refugee crisis, focusing on the suffering, resilience, and hope of those involved.
